org.transitime.utils

Class StringUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.transitime.utils.StringUtils

  • public class StringUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Simple string utilities such as for formating double to desired number of decimal places.
    Author:
    SkiBu Smith

    • Method Detail

      • memoryFormat

        public static java.lang.String memoryFormat(long arg)
        Returns formatted string indicating number of bytes. Uses highest possible units, up to 4 digits. will get a result such as 4,231MB
        Parameters:
        arg -
        Returns:

      • distanceFormat

        public static java.lang.String distanceFormat(double distance)
        Outputs distance string along with units. If value below 3,000 then uses meters as in 392.2m . If greater than 3,000 then uses km as in 3.1km .
        Parameters:
        distance -
        Returns:
        The distance as a string

      • padWithBlanks

        public static java.lang.String padWithBlanks(java.lang.String original,
                                             int desiredCharacters)
        Returns original string padded with spaces so that it is desiredCharacters long. If the original string is already at least as long as desired then it is returned.
        Parameters:
        original -
        desiredCharacters -
        Returns:

      • paddedName

        public static java.lang.String paddedName(java.lang.String name)
        Returns the name passed in, but the first number in the name is padded with zeros so that the numbers have the same number of digits. This way can sort the names properly even if have names such as Y2 and Y101 (Y2 should be before Y101 even though if used regular string comparison Y101 would be before Y2).
        Parameters:
        name - The alpha numeric name to be padded.
        Returns:
        a modified version of the name that can be used for proper ordering of a collection of names. for ordering

      • sortIdsNumerically

        public static void sortIdsNumerically(java.util.List<java.lang.String> ids)
        Sorts the list of IDs. Pads the first numeric part of the identifiers when doing the sorting so that numbers will end up in the proper order. This is 10 times slower than sortIds(), but the ordering is much nicer.
        Parameters:
        ids -

      • sortIds

        public static void sortIds(java.util.List<java.lang.String> ids)
        Sorts the list of IDs. Uses a regular string sort. Much faster than sorting IDs numerically because don't need to pad the IDs in order for them to be ordered properly. But then number won't be in the proper order. For example, "10" will end up before "9".
        Parameters:
        ids - to be sorted
